intro: Englerina triplinervia, commonly known as the three-veined vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves with three prominent veins. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
